sen.j: 車持皇子（くらもちのみこ）は、『竹取物語』に登場する五人の貴公子のひとり。
sen.e: Prince Kurumamochi (Kuramochi no miko) is one of five kikoshi (a young nobleman) who appeared in "Taketori Monogatari" (the Tale of Bumboo Cutter).

sen.e: It seems that he is a fictitious person as there is no such a prince with this name.

sen.j: ただし、五人の貴公子のうち三人までが実在のため、車持皇子も歴史に埋もれている実在人物か、または既知の実在人物の別名の可能性がある。
sen.e: However, considering the fact that the three out of five kikoshi existed, the Prince Ishizukuri may be an actual person who was not recorded in history or the known person with a different name.

sen.j: 江戸時代の国学者加納諸平は元明天皇朝の右大臣藤原不比等を挙げている(不比等の母は車持氏)。
sen.e: Morohira KANO, a scholar of Japanese classical literature in the Edo Period points out the possibility that FUJIWARA no Fuhito, udaijin (minister of the right) in the reign of Empress Genmei, may be the Prince Kurumamochi (Fuhito's mother is the Kuramochi clan).

sen.e: There is another theory that the Prince Kuramochi is a prince of either Emperor Tenchi or Emperor Tenmu because Fuhito is not a prince.

sen.j: 『竹取物語』では、かぐや姫から自分と結婚する条件として、東方海上にあるという「蓬莱の玉の枝」を取ってくるようにいわれる。
sen.e: In "Taketori Monogatari" (the Tale of Bumboo Cutter), Kaguya-hime (Princess Kaguya) told him to bring 'the branch of a tree with juseled fruit from Penglai,' which is said to be on the eastern ocean, as a condition for marrying her.

sen.j: だが、彼は出航せず、綾部内麻呂ら職人たちにそれらしきものを作らせ、帰航を偽装してこれをかぐや姫に献上した。
sen.e: He didn't head for the eastern ocean, and had craftsmen including Ayabe no uchimaro make a fake and presented it to Kaguya-hime, on the pretence that he had been to the eastern ocean.

sen.e: The old bamboo-hewer believed the branch which the Prince Kurumamochi brought was real, and started to prepare a bed for him.
